title: Ticket #7824: Further Python binding exceptions improvement
description:
The following are unaddressed issues from JoshK's review:

  • There are a few places that something like THROW_EX(ClassAdEvaluationError, "Unable to evaluate expression"); happens; it would be nice if we could get a more detailed error message in.

  • I would maybe call HTCondorEnumError something like HTCondorInvalidEnumMember to make it more specific. In general, exception don't need to be *Error... though I don't think there are really better names for most of these. One could argue between HTCondorLocateError and e.g. FailedToLocateDaemon; I don't think it matters much.

Other ideas:

  • Add one or more THROW_EX() variants (possibly exception-specific) to make it easier to create exceptions with more data members (e.g., errno). This of course implies adding data members to the exceptions.
  • THROW_EX_FORMAT()
  • THROW_EX_WITH_ERRNO()?
